item.title: This is¬†25
item.description: Exactly 25 years ago, Peter Mattis wrote a message to several newsgroups announcing a new image editor called GIMP.

item.description: GIMP 2.99.2 marks the first step towards GIMP 3 based on GTK3.

item.title: GIMP 2.10.18¬†Released
item.description: “We skipped announcing 2.10.16 due to a critical bug. Together, the two updates deliver several major usability improvements, a new tool for transformations in 3D space, new release checker, and the usual amount of bug fixes.”
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: GIMP and GEGL in¬†2019
item.description: Here is what we did in 2019 and what we are planning to do in 2020.

item.description: GIMP 2.10.14 is now released with major enhancements and 45 bugfixes.

item.description: In this post, we are looking back at 2018 and then forward to outline future work on GIMP, GEGL, and babl.

item.title: GIMP 2.10.6¬†Released
item.description: GIMP 2.10.6 released with vertical text layers, faster previews, Marathi translation, and more!
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: GIMP 2.10.4¬†Released
item.description: The latest update of the stable series delivers bugfixes, simple horizon straightening, async fonts loading, fonts tagging, and more new features.
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP has moved to¬†Gitlab
item.description: GIMP has moved to new Gitlab-based infrastructure provided by GNOME.

item.description: GIMP 2.10.2 released (bug fixes, HEIF support and new filters)

item.description: GIMP 2.10.0-rc1: bugfixes, stability and polish
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: Libre Graphics Meeting + SCaLE¬†2018
item.description: This year is starting off great with not one, but two libre graphics oriented events (one in Europe and the other in North America - for even better coverage)!
item.dc:creator: Pat David

item.title: GIMP and GEGL in¬†2017
item.description: When you say you mostly do bugfixing now, seven kinds of new features will crawl under your bed and bite your silly toes off. If we were to come up with a short summary for 2017, it would be along those very lines.
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: Strings Freeze For GIMP 2.10 Is Now¬†On
item.description: GIMP’s master branch is now entering a tentative strings freeze phase in preparation for 2.10 release.
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP 2.9.8¬†Released
item.description: GIMP 2.9.8 introduces on-canvas gradient editing and various enhancements while focusing on bugfixing and stability.
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP 2.9.6¬†Released
item.description: After more than a year of hard work we are excited to release GIMP 2.9.6 featuring many improvements, some new features, translation updates for 23 languages, and 204 bug fixes.
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: An Interview with Michael Schumacher, GIMP¬†administrator
item.description: Michael Schumacher gets interviewed by other GIMP developers
item.dc:creator: Jehan

item.title: GIMP 2.8.22¬†Released
item.description: We are releasing GIMP 2.8.22 with various bug fixes.
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: An Interview with Michael Natterer, GIMP¬†maintainer
item.description: Michael Natterer gets interviewed by other GIMP developers
item.dc:creator: Jehan

item.title: GIMP 2.8.20 Packages for macOS and Microsoft Windows are¬†available
item.description: GIMP 2.8.20 packages for macOS and Microsoft Windows are available now.
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: GIMP 2.10 blockers and the road to¬†3.0
item.description: During Wilber Week 2017 in Barcelona, the GEGL/GIMP team discussed further development plans.
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP 2.8.20¬†Released
item.description: We are releasing GIMP 2.8.20 with various bug fixes.
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: WilberWeek¬†2017
item.description: On January 27 - February 5, the team is meeting in Barcelona for WilberWeek‚Äîa week of project planning and vicious hacking.
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: Community-supported development of GEGL now¬†live
item.description: Almost every new major feature people have been asking us for, be it high bit depth support, or full CMYK support, or layer effects, would be impossible without having a robust, capable image processing core. You can help us fund further development of GEGL now.
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: 2016 in¬†review
item.description: When we released GIMP 2.9.2 in late 2015 and stepped over into 2016, we already knew that we’d be doing mostly polishing. This turned out to be true to a larger extent, but quite a few new features slipped in. So, what are the big changes for GIMP in 2016?
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: Making settings persistent in GIMP
item.description: Until fairly recently GIMP didn’t do a very good job of remembering all the types of possible customizations. Upcoming v2.10 has some major improvements in that department.
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP 2.8.18¬†Released
item.description: We are releasing GIMP 2.8.18 to fix a vulnerability in the XCF loading code (CVE-2016-4994).
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: GIMP 2.9.4¬†Released
item.description: We have just released the second development version of GIMP in the 2.9.x series. GIMP 2.9.4 features revamped look and feel, major improvements in color management, as well as production-ready MyPaint Brush tool, symmetric painting, and split preview for GEGL-based filters.
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: GIMPers at Texas Linux Fest¬†2016
item.description: If you happen to be anywhere near Austin, TX next weekend (July 8-9) then mosey on down to [Texas Linux Fest 2016][txlf] and meet some of your friendly neighborhood GIMP crew!
item.dc:creator: Pat David

item.title: GEGL 0.3.8 and babl 0.1.18¬†Released
item.description: New version of GEGL and babl are out with new features, minor improvements, and fixes to accomodate upcoming GIMP 2.9.4.
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: Updated 2.8.16 Installer with a Major Bugfix¬†Released
item.description: With the past few releases, users on the 32-bit versions of Microsoft Windows platforms were plagued by an annoying bug ‚Äî resizing a window crashed GIMP. We believe this to be fixed, and have released an updated installer.
item.dc:creator: Michael Schumacher

item.title: Call for GIMP 2.10 Documentation¬†Update
item.description: For the past several months we’ve been working on GIMP mostly in the bugfix mode. It’s time to start updating the user manual for the upcoming release.
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: Revamping¬†Tutorials
item.description: As part of building a new GIMP website we had to sort through all of the legacy pages in order to migrate content properly. A nice side effect of this sorting included addressing tutorials that were out of date (or in some cases, really out of date). This gave us ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Pat David

item.title: Updated Windows Installer¬†Signature
item.description: The Windows installer packages for GIMP 2.8.16 were reported as corrupt when downloaded with the Microsoft Edge or Internet Explorer 11 browsers. The current installer package fixes this.
item.dc:creator: Michael Schumacher

item.title: Corrupt Windows Installer¬†Warnings
item.description: The Windows installer packages for GIMP 2.8.16 are reported as corrupt when downloaded with the Microsoft Edge or Internet Explorer 11 browsers. This is due to a policy by Microsoft.
item.dc:creator: Michael Schumacher

item.title: GEGL 0.3.6¬†Released
item.description: Last weekend, we released a new version of GEGL, graph based image processing framework used by GIMP and other free/libre graphics applications.
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: StreamComputing launches GEGL-OpenCL¬†project
item.description: This week, StreamComputing launches an educational initiative that aims to get more developers to study and use OpenCL in their projects. Within this project, up to 20 collaborators will port as many GEGL operations to OpenCL as possible.
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: Libre Graphics Meeting¬†2016
item.description: Join us April 15-18 at the 11th annual Libre Graphics Meeting being hosted by Westminster School of Media Arts and Design in London, UK! Come and meet developers of free graphics software, participate in a workshop, and collaborate with other visual artists who choose to work in free software.
item.dc:creator: Pat David

item.title: GIMP and GEGL in¬†2015
item.description: We hope you are having great holidays. Here is our annual report about project activities in 2015.
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: Libre Graphics Meeting 2016 Calls For¬†Participation
item.description: On April 15‚Äî18, Libre Graphics Meeting 2016 conference is taking place in London. We invite you to attend it and meet developers of free graphics software, lead a workshop, or participate in one.
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP 2.9.2¬†Released
item.description: We are excited to announce the first development release of GIMP in the 2.9.x series. It is another major milestone towards making GIMP a state-of-the art image editing application for graphic designers, photographers, illustrators, and scientists.
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: 20 Years of GIMP, release of GIMP¬†2.8.16
item.description: This week the GIMP project celebrates its 20th anniversary. To celebrate it, we released an update of the current stable version of GIMP.
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: GEGL 0.3.0, babl 0.1.12¬†Released
item.description: We have just released new versions of GEGL and babl, the libraries that take all the heavy lifting for color space conversion and image processing in GIMP.
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP Project‚Äôs Official Statement on SourceForge‚Äôs¬†Actions
item.description: This is the GIMP project’s official statement on SourceForge’s actions in regard to “abandoned” projects on their service.
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: SourceForge, What¬†the‚Ä¶?
item.description: We are receiving reports that people who get to SourceForge for GIMP installers for Windows receive small installers that include additional software.
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: ZeMarmot, Libre Movie to be Made with GIMP, Blender,¬†Ardour
item.description: During Libre Graphics Meeting 2015 last week in Toronto our very own Jehan Pag√®s announced a new open animated movie project, ZeMarmot.
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: Libre Graphics Meeting¬†2015
item.description: Two months to go till Libre Graphics Meeting 2015 happens in Toronto, Canada. This conference is a great place to meet the people who make and use free and open source graphics software.
item.dc:creator: Michael Schumacher

item.title: gimpguru.org ‚Äî R.I.P.
item.description: We noticed that gimpguru.org, once the host of GIMP tutorials, has been abandoned by its original owner and is redirecting visitors to some very suspicious downloads‚Äîdon’t go there.
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: GIMP and GEGL in¬†2014
item.description: In 2014, we spent most of the time on improving GIMP’s usability and finalizing the GEGL port of GIMP to lay the foundation for various advanced features in demand by professionals.
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: The Price of Being¬†Popular
item.description: When software is popular, then there are elements out there who seek to profit from it by less ethical means. GIMP is being attacked in that manner as well.
item.dc:creator: Michael Schumacher

item.title: GIMP Magazine Issue #6¬†Released
item.description:
The newly released issue #6 of GIMP Magazine features a “Using GIMP for portrait and fashion photography” master class by Aaron Tyree who uses GIMP professionally, and a gallery of other artworks and photos made or processed with GIMP.

The team is planning to switch to monthly releases, however they ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Wilber Gimp

item.title: Updated 2.8.14 Installer for Microsoft¬†Windows
item.description:
We have released an updated 2.8.14 installer (http) for Microsoft Windows. This one fixes the crash on window resize and the missing icons bugs - all by updating the included GTK+ library to 2.24.24.

Still unsolved are the missing spacing character in the zoom drop down and ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Wilber Gimp

item.title: GIMP 2.8.14¬†Released
item.description: Yesterday’s 2.8.12 release had broken library versioning, so we had to roll out GIMP 2.8.14 today. The only change is the fixed libtool versioning. Please do not distribute any binaries of yesterday’s broken 2.8.12 release, and get GIMP 2.8.14 using ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Wilber Gimp

item.title: GIMP Manual 2.8.2¬†released
item.description:
A new version of the user manual has been released. Changes include:

  • complete translation to Brazilian Portuguese
  • many, many, many bugfixes

You can click here to download the 2.8.2 release package. This release provides only the sources to build the help used by the GIMP Help browser. Find ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Wilber Gimp

item.title: Gimp-Perl release candidate ready for¬†testing
item.description: It’s been possible to use various scripting languages to automate GIMP for a long time. But until recently Perl bindings for GIMP were considerably out of date due to lack of interest from contributors. Fortunately, a while ago Ed J started working on updating those, and now a release ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Wilber Gimp

item.title: Download server renamed to download.gimp.org, no FTP¬†anymore
item.description:
Heads-up if you are still accessing the downloads via ftp.gimp.org:

The downloads server has been renamed to download.gimp.org, and it doesn’t support FTP anymore. If you have linked any file, installer package, source archive or directory with an ftp://-Link, please change it to https ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Michael Schumacher

item.title: Libre Graphics Meeting¬†2014
item.description:
The Libre Graphics Meeting is a conference where artists, users, developers, designers, contributors,… who use, plan, develop, play with, tamper with free, libre and open source graphics applications, libraries, concepts,…

It is an unparalleled opportunity for them to meet, talk, discuss, listen, experience and learn about their favorite tools, the ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Michael Schumacher

item.title: What we did in¬†2013
item.description:
Before you leave for the holidays, we thought you’d like an overview of what we did this year to improve GIMP for you.

Most of the time was spent on improving the GEGL-based version of GIMP (to be released as v2.10) and porting GIMP plugins to GEGL ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP 2.8.10¬†released
item.description: We just released GIMP 2.8.10 ! This is a release in the stable GIMP 2.8 series. This release fixes a bug that prevented older GIMP versions from running on OS X Mavericks. We also did some small adjustments to the Save/Export code in order to make things ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP Manual 2.8.1¬†released
item.description:
We’ve released a new version of the user manual with:

  • Many, many, many bugfixes
  • New (incomplete) translations: Brazilian Portuguese, Danish, Catalan
  • The online version of the manual provides a language menu. Readers are now able to easily switch to a different language of the same page.
  • It is now ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Michael Schumacher

item.title: Google Summer of Code 2013¬†Results
item.description:
GSoC2013 program is over now, and 3 out of 4 students successfully completed it.

Carlos Zubieta ported 13 GEGL operations to use GPU via OpenCL, and the gegl-random module used by noise generation operations, then made noise-hsv and noise-cie-lch operations use it. You can read his report.

Simon Lui ported ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: Sponsoring symmetric painting¬†mode
item.description: Jehan Pag√®s, one of our active contributors, started a personal crowdfunding campaign to sponsor his work on symmetric painting in GIMP. You can find more information in his blog, and there’s a video of a proof-of-concept implementation on YouTube. If you care about GIMP as a tool for digital ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP Magazine #4¬†published
item.description: The fourth issue of GIMP Magazine is now out and available as a digital download, a printed copy, and an e-zine for iPad. In just a year the project got a huge following, and now it’d a 100 pages large magazine with interviews, tutorials, a gallery section, and a ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP 2.8.6¬†Released
item.description: We just released GIMP 2.8.6! This is a release in the stable GIMP 2.8 series, featuring lots of bug fixes and translation updates. For the complete list of changes please see the NEWS file.
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: Four Students to Work on GIMP During GSoC2013¬†Program
item.description:
Four students will be working on GIMP and GEGL this summer thanks to Google Summer of Code 2013 program.

  • Ajay Ramanathan will be working on a combined selection tool;
  • Carlos Zubieta will be porting GEGL operations to OpenCL;
  • Simon Lui will improve support for PSD in GIMP (text layers as ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: Four Students to Work on GIMP During GSoC2013¬†Program
item.description:
GIMP will be taking part in this year’s Google Summer of Code program as a mentoring organization. We are inviting interested students to get in touch with us and start discussing potential projects.

Some project ideas have already been posted in the wiki, but you are free to come ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: Four Students to Work on GIMP During GSoC2013¬†Program
item.description: Yesterday Google announced Summer of Code 2013 program. Participating at GSoC has proved to be rather beneficial to us. Here are just some of the features implemented during past runs of the program: five new tools (Heal, Perspective Clone, Cage Transform, Warp Transform, Seamless Paste), resources tagging, hardware acceleration in ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP 2.8.4 for OSX¬†Available
item.description:
GIMP 2.8.4 is now available as disk image for Mac OSX.

Please note that with this release, we have moved GIMP’s per-user data from “~/Library” to “~/Library/Application Support”. If you had installed GIMP 2.8.2 before, please open a terminal and enter the following command ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP 2.8.4¬†Released
item.description:
GIMP 2.8.4 is out! This is a release in the stable GIMP 2.8 series, featuring lots of bug fixes and translation updates. For the complete list of changes please see the NEWS file.

Pre-built binaries for Mac will be available soon.
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP in¬†2012
item.description:
As 2013 is fast approaching, we‚Äôd like to take a quick look at 2012 and what we did during the year.

In May we released the long anticipated new stable version, v2.8, with many improvements such as layer groups, tagging of resources, new Cage transform tool and more ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP Gets ICC v4 Color Profiles¬†Support
item.description:
For the last few weeks GIMP has been capable of using ICC v4 color profiles thanks to a patch by Laurent Martelli who ported the color management plug-in to use LittleCMS v2.

There is also an ongoing work by Elle Stone to adapt that plug-in to the new GEGL-based ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: Google Summer of Code 2012 Is¬†Over
item.description:
Four out of five GIMP students successfully finished their work in the Google Summer of Code 2012 program. Unfortunately one of the students wasn’t able to complete all of the work.

The code written by the students has already been merged to main development branches and is expected to ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP 2.8.2¬†Released
item.description:
We’ve just released GIMP 2.8.2, the first update to the new stable version of GIMP. The update brings several dozens of fixes to various issues of all scales.

Most notorious bugs fixed are: not being able to remember JPEG saving options, slow canvas redraw, not showing page ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: We Are Looking for Windows¬†Developers
item.description: It’s been a long time since we last had an active Windows-based developer. Consequently, GIMP has accumulated a plethora of bugs specific for that operating system. As much as we’d like to provide a smooth user experience for Windows users, we simply do not have the required human ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: All GSoC 2012 Students Passed Midterm¬†Evaluation
item.description:
We are glad to announce that all of our Google Summer of Code 2012 students passed the midterm evaluation last week.

All projects are coming along nicely. The unified transform is already quite functional, the experimental GEGL editor is maturing, more filters were rewritten into GEGL operations, and more parts ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: New Usability¬†Project
item.description:
Since 2006 we’ve been improving GIMP’s user interface with help from Peter Sikking and his team at man + machine interface works. Some of the best improvements in GIMP’s UI over past several years are the direct result of our collaboration.

We are happy to announce that for ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: High Bit Depth Processing Available¬†Now
item.description:
Today at Libre Graphics Meeting 2012 in Vienna we announced that the development version of GIMP is now capable of processing images in 16bit and 32bit modes, integer or float at your preference.

Transformation, painting and color adjustment tools will just work in higher bit depth precision modes. More than ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP 2.8¬†Released
item.description:
We are happy to announce immediate availability of GIMP 2.8‚Äîa new stable version of GNU Image Manipulation Program that culminates 3.5 years of exciting work.

With this version we are introducing some long-anticipated features such as layer groups, on-canvas text editing, advanced brush dynamics and the much ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP and GEGL Projects for GSoC2012¬†Announced
item.description:
We are excited to announce that we have five students to work with us on improving GIMP as part of the Google Summer of Code 2012 program. All the students will be contributing to faster transition of GIMP to GEGL, our new advanced image core.

The projects are:

  • Maxime Nicco ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP‚Äôs Core Getting Ported to GEGL
item.description:
In late 2007 we launched smooth transition to GEGL‚Äîa new advanced image processing core incepted by a team of Rhythm & Hues developers.

For v2.6 we made an optional GEGL-based implementation of color adjustment tools, and for upcoming v2.8 we implemented optional projection rendering via GEGL. But ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GEGL and babl Updated, GIMP 2.8rc1¬†Released
item.description:
We released new versions of GEGL and babl, quickly followed by the first release candidate of GIMP 2.8.

GEGL 0.2.0 has some major improvements and breaks API/ABI compatibility with earlier versions for some very good reasons.

Perhaps the most exciting change in GEGL is an initial ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP Accepted for¬†GSoC2012
item.description:
GIMP has been accepted to Google Summer of Code 2012 program. This is a great chance for aspiring developers to get a good understanding of remote collaborative work and coincidentally help the project become an even better image editor.

We put together a list of project ideas that you might ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP 2.7.5¬†Released
item.description:
We’ve just released GIMP 2.7.5, the last beta in the 2.7.x series. This version got various fixes and improvements, translation updates and a few minor features such as configurable default color of quick masks.

Since this version GIMP is shipping with a revamped brush pack ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP at Libre Graphics Meeting¬†2012
item.description:
On May 2‚Äì5 we are attending Libre Graphics Meeting 2012, the annual conference for developers and users of free software for graphic design, photography and 3D modeling. The event is taking place in the beautiful city of Vienna, co-located with Linuxwochen.

The conference started in 2006 as an extended ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP 2.6.12 Released ‚Äì The Final 2.6¬†Release
item.description: GIMP 2.6.12 is a bug-fix release in the stable GIMP 2.6 series. Its purpose is mostly to wrap up all fixes that have piled up since 2.6.11 into a last release in the stable 2.6 series before we switch to 2.8. Please have ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP 2.7.4 Released, GEGL and babl¬†Updated
item.description: We released GIMP 2.7.4 with minor improvements and bugfixes. Most improvements are related to user interface and usability, see here for detailed list of changes. Depending on amount of bugs we get reports on this could be the last version before 2.8 release candidates and 2.8 ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: AMD Sponsors Further Work on OpenCL Support in GEGL
item.description:
Victor Oliveira, our GSoC2011 student, is going to continue his work on getting OpenCL support in GEGL for hardware accelerated rendering and computations. AMD got interested in the project and agreed to sponsor it.

The plan is to implement GPU-side color conversions and compositing operations, as well as some ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: Mailing Lists Moved to GNOME Mailing List¬†Server
item.description:
Our mailing lists have moved to the GNOME list server. All previously subscribed users have automatically been added to the new lists.

The old list mail addresses are no longer valid, please use the new ones from now‚Äìnote that in addition to the changed domain, the list names got ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Michael Schumacher

item.title: Online Docs and Developer Pages¬†Restored
item.description:
The online docs and developer pages are available again:

  • Online Docs (docs.gimp.org)
  • Developer Pages (developer.gimp.org)
item.dc:creator: Michael Schumacher

item.title: FTP and Wiki Back¬†Online
item.description:
We managed to get FTP and Wiki back online:

  • FTP Downloads (ftp.gimp.org)
  • Developer Wiki (wiki.gimp.org)
item.dc:creator: Michael Schumacher

item.title: Mailing list, FTP and Documentation¬†Outage
item.description:
Due to relocation onto a different server, the following services are currently not available:

  • Mailing lists (lists.xcf.berkeley.edu)
  • FTP Downloads (ftp.gimp.org)
  • Documentation (docs.gimp.org)
  • Developer website (developer.gimp.org)
  • Developer Wiki (wiki.gimp.org)
item.dc:creator: Michael Schumacher

item.title: GSoC2011 is¬†Over
item.description:
Google Summer of Code 2011 is over, and all of our students have successfully finished their respective projects. All of the code is available in Git repositories, but not all of it is going to be part of the next released versions of GEGL and GIMP. Here is why.

Both ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP 2.7.3¬†Released
item.description:
We are pleased to announce availability of a new development version that brings us closer to GIMP 2.8. This version is packed with important new features and improvements.

The most visible changes in 2.7.3 are the fully working single-window mode, including working session management, and the introduction ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: On GPU-side Rendering and Further Development¬†Plans
item.description:
While GEGL gradually replaces GIMP’s old core, it’s time for us to consider long-term strategy for improving performance. The trend these days seems to be a combination of multithreading, GPU-side processing and networks. Most of that can be handled thanks to OpenCL standard by Khronos Group.

Back ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: All GSoC Students Passed Midterm¬†Evaluation
item.description:
We are glad to announce that all of our Google Summer of Code students have passed midterm evaluation. All the code is being maintained in respective Git branches of GEGL and GIMP.

As a reminder, this year Google Summer of Code is bringing us two new tools, Seamless Clone and ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: Two New Books on GIMP¬†Published
item.description: Two new books on GIMP have been published recently. “GIMP 2.6 Cookbook”, in English, by Juan Manuel Ferreyra is a collection of straightforward instructions that will help you accomplishing typical design and photography related tasks. This book is packed with answers to get you preparing great images with the ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: Google Summer of Code 2011 Projects¬†Announced
item.description:
We are pleased to announce that we have five projects accepted for Google Summer of Code 2011 program:

  • Adaptive cloning will provide means to paste an object from a different picture in a way that it will seamlessly blend into the new image, matching its brightness and color characteristics. This ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP 2.7.2¬†Released
item.description: We are pleased to announce availability of a new development version that brings us closer to GIMP 2.8. This version is packed with important new features and improvements. For a complete list of changes since 2.7.1 please refer to NEWS page, while the release notes summarize changes ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: Progress of GIMP development is now¬†trackable
item.description: One of the most common questions we keep hearing is when the next version of GIMP is released. While it’s difficult to define exact dates, it is possible to estimate how far away a new stable release from now is based on amount of work that has to be ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: We Are Participating in Google Summer of Code¬†2011
item.description: This year we are participating in the Google Summer of Code program again. If you are a student who is willing to improve GIMP and be financially rewarded ($5000), please have a look at the list of project ideas, pick one or come up with your own idea, then join ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GEGL 0.1.6 and babl¬†0.1.4
item.description:
After a year of work new versions of GEGL, new non-destructive image processing core, and babl, a bitmap format conversion library, are out with several major changes.

The new version of GEGL features code created during Google Summer of Code 2010 by Danny Robson and Michael Mur√©. Danny Robson created ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: Two Interns to Work on GIMP‚Äôs¬†Usability
item.description: Since 2006 our project has been collaborating with Peter Sikking of m+mi works to improve GIMP’s usability. Peter is behind many positive changes in GIMP’s UI, such as new selection tools in v2.4 and v2.6, as well as some new features in upcoming v2.8 ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: Plans for 2.8 and¬†Beyond
item.description:
In the face of all sorts of rumours and interpretations about the future of the project there is a call for clarification regarding development of GIMP.

Currently GIMP team is working on finalizing the new stable v2.8 with many improvements such as layer groups, improved brush dynamics, a new ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP Manual 2.6.1¬†Released
item.description:
We’ve released a new version of the user manual with:

  • many, many, many bugfixes
  • spelling fixes and new translations for: Italian, English, German, French, Japnese, Norwegian, Swedish, Russian, Korean
  • website typo fixes

This release does not only include pre-built documentation for all the supported languages, we also publish the ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Michael Schumacher

item.title: GIMP 2.6.11¬†Released
item.description:
GIMP 2.6.11 is a bug-fix release in the stable GIMP 2.6 series. Among other bug-fixes, it makes printing work with the recently released version 1.10 of the Cairo library. Please have a look at the NEWS file for a detailed list of changes.

The source can ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Michael Schumacher

item.title: Google Summer of Code 2010¬†Results
item.description:
This year GIMP participated in the annual Google Summer of Code program with three projects. Two out of three projects have been successful: Cage transform tool in GIMP and HDR and matting functions in GEGL.

The new Cage transform tool allows doing shape-preserving deformations of objects. The tool is based ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Prokoudine

item.title: GIMP 2.6.10¬†Released
item.description:
Unfortunately a rather bad bug sneaked into GIMP 2.6.9, so here’s another release in the stable GIMP 2.6 series to fix this issue. Please have a look at the NEWS file for a more detailed list of changes.

The source can be downloaded from ftp.gimp ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Michael Schumacher

item.title: GIMP 2.7.1¬†Released
item.description:
It is about time… For a new development snapshot on the way to the next stable version GIMP 2.8. This release brings a whole lot of new features and improvements, see the release notes and the NEWS file for details.

The source can be downloaded from ftp.gimp.org ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Michael Schumacher

item.title: GIMP 2.6.9¬†Released
item.description: It’s been a while since the last release. Quite a few bug-fixes have piled up in the stable branch, so here’s another release in the stable GIMP 2.6 series.
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: GIMP 2.6.8¬†Released
item.description: GIMP 2.6.8 is a bug-fix release in the stable GIMP 2.6 series.
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: Gimp Help Released for GIMP¬†2.6
item.description: The GIMP documentation team has been working hard and is proud to announce the availability of the first release of the user manual for GIMP 2.6.
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: GIMP 2.7.0 Development¬†Release
item.description: The release of GIMP 2.7.0 is a first step towards GIMP 2.8, the next stable release.
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: GIMP 2.6.7¬†Released
item.description: GIMP 2.6.7 comes with lots of bug-fixes and it contains an important fix for using GIMP with the latest GEGL and babl releases.
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: GIMP Animation Package 2.6.0¬†Released
item.description: GAP 2.6.0 is a stable release of the video menu intended for use with the GIMP 2.6.x series.
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: Google Summer of Code - Student Application Period Has¬†Started
item.description: Google has started to accept applications from students for Summer of Code.
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: GIMP Has Been Accepted for Google Summer of¬†Code!
item.description: The the list of accepted organizations is published, and GIMP is one of them!
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: GIMP 2.6.6¬†Released
item.description: GIMP 2.6.6 is a bug-fix release in the stable GIMP 2.6 series. This release contains an important fix for compiling GIMP against the recently released GTK+ 2.16.
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: Libre Graphics Meeting¬†2009
item.description: For four years, the Libre Graphics Meeting has been the premiere conference for developers, users and supporters of free software graphics applications.
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: GIMP 2.6.5¬†Released
item.description: GIMP 2.6.5 is a bugfix release in the stable GIMP 2.6 series.
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: Happy New¬†Year
item.description: The GIMP developers welcome you in the new year with the fourth bugfix release in the stable GIMP 2.6 series.
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: GIMP 2.6.3¬†Released
item.description: GIMP 2.6.3 is another bugfix release in the stable GIMP 2.6 series.
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: GIMP 2.6.2¬†Released
item.description: The GIMP development team has made another bugfix release in the stable GIMP 2.6 series.
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: GIMP 2.6.1¬†Released
item.description: GIMP 2.6.1 is a bugfix release in the stable GIMP 2.6 series.
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: GIMP User Manual 2.4.2¬†Released
item.description: An update of the GIMP user manual is available. This release is still focused on GIMP 2.4. Work has started on updating the user manual for GIMP 2.6.
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: GIMP 2.6.0¬†Released
item.description: The GIMP developers are proud to release GIMP 2.6.0 today.
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: GIMP 2.5.4 Development Version¬†Release
item.description: GIMP approaches the next stable release and only a handful bugs are left to be fixed before GIMP 2.6 is ready.
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: GIMP 2.5.3 Development Version¬†Release
item.description: GIMP 2.5.3 is a fresh snapshot from the 2.5 development series. It gives developers and interested users a preview of the upcoming GIMP 2.6 release.
item.dc:creator: Wilber

item.title: Open Usability and GIMP
item.description: The GIMP team is proud to announce that the GNU Image Manipulation Program has been chosen as the first Open Source Software project for a sponsored student project on usability.
item.dc:creator: Wilber
